task.name: Niche Research Protocol
task.objective: Structured research methodology for Agent Cipher to analyze competitive landscape and niche patterns

llm.mandate: Research must be specific, tactical, and actionable - not vague observations
Focus on what ACTUALLY converts in this niche, backed by patterns and data
Identify both what to emulate AND what to differentiate from

phase.title: Identify Top Performers
phase.action:
Based on niche and offer type, identify top performing competitors:
- If user provided competitors, analyze those plus identify top performers - Look for established players with visible traction (reviews, social proof, traffic indicators) - Mix of direct competitors and aspirational benchmarks - Aim for diversity: different approaches, price points, positioning

phase.title: Architecture Pattern Analysis
phase.action:
For each competitor, document their landing page architecture:
**Section Analysis:** - What sections do they include? - What order/sequence? - What comes first (hero approach)? - Where do they place proof? - Where do they handle objections? - How many sections total?
**Pattern Identification:** - What patterns appear across multiple competitors? - What seems to be "table stakes" for this niche? - What unique approaches stand out? - What sections are universally present? - What varies most between competitors?

specific-elements-to-note.element: Social proof placement and format (testimonials, case studies, logos, numbers)
Objection handling approach (FAQ, inline, comparison tables)
CTA strategy (one primary, multiple, soft vs hard)

phase.output: Architecture pattern summary by section type

phase.title: What Converts in This Niche
phase.action:
Synthesize patterns to identify niche-specific best practices:
**High-Confidence Patterns** (appear in 70%+ of top performers): - These are likely required for credibility in this niche - Recommend including unless there's strategic reason not to
**Common Patterns** (appear in 40-70% of top performers): - These are standard but not universal - Consider for inclusion based on strategy
**Unique Approaches** (appear in <40% but from high performers): - These might be differentiation opportunities - Evaluate for strategic fit

niche-characteristics.identify: How long are typical pages in this niche? (section count)
What's the typical awareness level this niche targets?
How technical vs emotional is the typical approach?
What proof types matter most (social, authority, data)?
What's the typical CTA ask (buy now, book call, trial)?

phase.output: Niche-specific conversion patterns and best practices

phase.title: Differentiation Gap Analysis
phase.action:
Identify what competitors are NOT doing well or consistently:
**Common Weaknesses:** - What do most competitors do poorly or miss entirely? - Where are there obvious gaps in coverage? - What objections go unaddressed? - What sections feel weak or generic?
**Saturation Points:** - What approaches are so common they no longer differentiate? - What messaging is so overused it's become noise? - Where does everyone sound the same?
**Opportunities:** - Where can the user's architecture stand out? - What gaps can be filled for competitive advantage? - What approaches are underutilized despite being effective?

phase.title: Benchmark Data and Metrics
phase.action:
Provide performance context for this niche:
**Conversion Benchmarks:** - Typical conversion rates for this niche/price point - What high performers achieve - What factors separate high from average performance
**Success Indicators:** - What metrics matter most in this niche? - What signals indicate effective architecture? - What should user track post-launch?

benchmark-sources.source: Pattern analysis from research (if X elements present, performance typically Y)
Offer type benchmarks (SaaS vs e-commerce vs services)

phase.output: Niche-specific conversion benchmarks and performance expectations

phase.title: Strategic Intelligence Briefing
phase.action:
Compile findings into actionable intelligence report:
**Executive Summary:** - [3-5 key insights about this niche]
**Architecture Intelligence:** - Must-have sections for credibility - Common patterns to consider - Unique approaches to evaluate
**Differentiation Strategy:** - Where competitors are weak - What's oversaturated (avoid copying) - Where to stand out
**Benchmarks:** - Expected conversion performance - Key success metrics
**Tactical Recommendations:** - Specific architecture suggestions based on research - What to emulate from top performers - What to do differently for advantage
phase.presentation-style: Present findings in Agent Cipher's voice: - "I've cracked the code on [niche] conversions..." - "Your competitors all [pattern], but here's the gap..." - "Based on analyzing [X] top performers, here's what actually works..." - Tactical, confident, intelligence-focused

quality-standards.standard: Every insight must be specific and actionable
Patterns must be documented with frequency data
Benchmarks must include ranges and context
Recommendations must connect research to action

validation.check: Minimum competitor count met for research depth
Intelligence briefing is tactical and focused
